hero.title: Me, Myself & I
description: MM&I are an online fashion retailer selling clothes aimed at 16-35 years old women. They are here to make a statement and challenge the leading fast fashion retailers based in the UK.
As they were coming to the market as a new brand, they needed to challenge competitors with bold branding and an engaging and responsive shopify store.

projectDetails.title: Branding
projectDetails.description: I designed MM&I’s branding to be bold and youthful to compete with leading fast fashion brands. I used 3 different fonts within the logo to represent ‘Me’, ‘Myself’ and ‘I’.

projectDetails.title: User Flow & Wireframes
projectDetails.description: I completed market research to understand the user experience of successful fast fashion. I translated this into a user flow which was the foundation of the wireframes.

projectDetails.title: Shopify Store
projectDetails.description: It was important to the client to have a customised e-commerce store. I did this by implementing and reconstructing shopify’s themes and guidelines.

text: To not get lost in the market, I designed MM&I’s store to be eye-catching, foolproof, and accessible.
The goal is always the checkout! To get customers to the purchasing point quick and successfully, I structured a 4 click path: ‘view collection’ > ‘view product’ > ‘add to basket’ > ‘checkout’.
By following e-commerce principles, MM&I now have a fully optimisable online store to out-stand competitors.
